data.question: What is the primary goal of the study described in the text?
data.answer: The primary goal of the study is to report a cubic zirconium-based MOF (Zr-MOF) platform, denoted as NU-1107, capable of achieving selective separation of Xe/Kr by post-synthetically engineering framework polarizability in a programmable manner.

data.question: How does NU-1107-Ag(I) compare to MOF-525-Ag(II) in terms of BET area and density of Ag site?
data.answer: NU-1107-Ag(I) has a BET area of 1400 m2/g and a density of Ag site of 0.51 mmol/g, while MOF-525-Ag(II) has a BET area of 2480 m2/g and a similar density of Ag site of 0.48 mmol/g.

data.question: What method was used for the activation of NU-1107 and its metalated analogues before gas sorption measurements?
data.answer: The samples were subjected to supercritical carbon dioxide (sc-CO2) activation followed by further activation under a dynamic vacuum for 4 hours at either room temperature or 120 °C.

data.question: What is the significance of the Henry's coefficient in the context of this study?
data.answer: The Henry's coefficient is used to evaluate the efficiency of MOFs in adsorbing gases, with higher values indicating better performance in gas adsorption. It is crucial for assessing the MOFs' capability for Xe/Kr separation.

data.question: Based on the study, which MOF shows the highest selectivity for Xe/Kr separation and what is its selectivity value?
data.answer: NU-1107-Ag(I) shows the highest selectivity for Xe/Kr separation with an IAST selectivity value of 13.4.

data.question: True or False: The study demonstrates that NU-1107-Ag(I) has a higher BET area compared to MOF-525-Ag(II).
data.answer: False. MOF-525-Ag(II) has a higher BET area (2480 m2/g) compared to NU-1107-Ag(I) (1400 m2/g).

data.question: What experimental technique was used to determine the crystal structure of the synthesized MOFs?
data.answer: Single crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD) was used to determine the crystal structure of the synthesized MOFs.

data.question: How does the study validate the interactions between Xe and the MOF frameworks?
data.answer: The study uses density functional theory (DFT) calculations to optimize the host–guest structure and validate the strong interactions between Xe and the exposed metal sites in the MOF frameworks.

data.question: True or False: NU-1107 and its metalated analogues show improved gas adsorption performance after being activated with supercritical carbon dioxide.
data.answer: True. The MOFs show improved gas adsorption performance after being activated with supercritical carbon dioxide (sc-CO2) and further dynamic vacuum activation.

data.question: What role do the cyclen-based chelating groups play in the design of NU-1107 for gas separation?
data.answer: The cyclen-based chelating groups in NU-1107 act as potent chelators to accommodate a series of transition-metal ions, offering an effective strategy to engineer framework polarizability and boost gas separation performance.
